text: A Message Concerning Moab
Concerning Moab, thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel:
“Woe to Nebo,
for it is devastated.
It is ashamed,
Kiriathaim is captured.
Misgab is ashamed,
and it is filled with terror.
The glory of Moab is no longer.
In Heshbon they planned evil against her.
Come and let us cut her off from \add being\add* a nation.
Also, Madmen, you will be silent.
After you will go \add the\add* sword.
\add The\add* sound of a cry of distress \add arises\add* from Horonaim,
devastation and great destruction.
Moab is broken,
her little ones ⸤make heard⸥\f + \fr 48:4 \ft Literally “cause to hear” \f* a cry for help.
For the ascent of Luhith,
in weeping they go weeping,
For on the slope of Horonaim they have heard
\add the\add* distresses of \add the\add* cry of distress of \add the\add* destruction.
Flee! Save your life!
⸤For⸥\f + \fr 48:6 \ft Literally “And” \f* you must not be like the juniper tree in the desert.
For because of your trusting in your works and in your treasures,
even you yourselves will be taken,
and Chemosh will go out into the exile,
his priests and his officials together.
And \add the\add* destroyer will come to every town,
and a town will not escape.
And the valley will be destroyed,
and the plain will be destroyed, as Yahweh has spoken.
Give salt for Moab,
for certainly she will go to ruin,
and her towns will become as a desolation,
⸤without⸥\f + \fr 48:9 \ft Literally “from there is not” \f* an inhabitant in them.
\add The one who\add* does the work of Yahweh \add with\add* slackness \add is\add* cursed,
and \add the one who\add* keeps away blood from his sword \add is\add* cursed.
Moab has been at ease from his youth,
and he has been quiet on his dregs,
and he has not been poured out from vessel to vessel,
and he has not gone into exile.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 48:11 \ft Literally “Unto thus” \f* his taste has remained unchanged,
and his fragrance has not changed.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 48:12 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* look, days \add are\add* coming,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:12 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and I will send to him ⸤decanters⸥,\f + \fr 48:12 \ft Literally “those who tilt” \f*
and they will decant him,
and his vessels they will empty out,
and their jars they will smash.
Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh,
just as the house of Israel were ashamed of Bethel, their trust.
How can you say, ‘we \add are\add* warriors,
and men of might for the battle.’
Moab is destroyed,
and his towns have gone up,
and the choice of his young men have gone down to the slaughtering,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:15 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* the King, Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* his name.
“The disaster of Moab \add is\add* near to come,
and his disaster ⸤approaches very quickly⸥.\f + \fr 48:16 \ft Literally “hastens greatly” \f*
Mourn for him, all his surroundings,
and all those who knew his name.
Say, ‘How \add the\add* staff of might is broken,
\add the\add* staff of glory.’
Come down from glory and sit on the parched ground,
O inhabitant, daughter of Dibon,
for the destroyer of Moab has come up against you,
he has destroyed your fortifications.
Stand by \add the\add* road and watch,
O inhabitant of Aroer.
Ask \add the man who is\add* fleeing and \add the woman who is\add* escaping,
say, ‘What has happened?’
Moab is ashamed,
for it is filled with terror.
Wail and cry out,
tell \add it\add* by Arnon that Moab is devastated.
Judgment has also come to the land of the plain, to Holon, and to Jahaz, and on Mephaath,
and on Dibon, and on Nebo, and on Beth-diblathaim,
and on Kiriathaim, and on Beth-gamul, and on Beth-meon,
and on Kerioth, and on Bozrah, and on all the towns of the land of Moab, the far and the near.
The horn of Moab is cut off and his arm is broken,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:25 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“Make him drunk,
because he magnified himself against Yahweh,
and let Moab wallow in his vomit.
And he also will become a laughingstock.
Now \add was\add* not Israel the laughingstock to you?
Or was he found among thieves?
For ⸤as often as⸥\f + \fr 48:27 \ft Literally “from enough” \f* you spoke over him
you shook \add your head\add*.
Leave \add the\add* towns and dwell on the rock,
O inhabitants of Moab,
and be like \add the\add* dove,
it nests on \add the\add* sides of \add the\add* mouth of a ravine.
We have heard \add of\add* the pride of Moab
—\add he is\add* very proud—
his height, and his pride, and his arrogance,
and the haughtiness of his heart.
I know his insolence,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:30 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and his boastings \add are\add* ⸤false⸥;\f + \fr 48:30 \ft Literally “not right” \f*
they act ⸤falsely⸥.\f + \fr 48:30 \ft Literally “not right” \f*
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 48:31 \ft Literally “Unto thus” \f* over Moab I wail,
and for all of Moab I cry out,
for the people\f + \fr 48:31 \ft Or “men” \f* of Kir-heres I moan.
More than the weeping of Jazer
I weep for you, O vine Sibmah.
Your branches cross over \add the\add* sea,
up to the sea of Jazer they reach.
Upon your summer fruit and upon your vintage
\add the\add* destroyer has fallen.
And joy and rejoicing have been taken away from \add the\add* fruitful land,
even from the land of Moab.
And \add the\add* wine from \add the\add* wine presses
I have caused to disappear.
He will not tread \add with\add* exuberant shouts.\f + \fr 48:33 \ft Hebrew “exuberant shout” \f*
Exuberant shouts\f + \fr 48:33 \ft Hebrew “Exuberant shout” \f* \add will\add* not \add be\add* exuberant shouts.\f + \fr 48:33 \ft Hebrew “exuberant shout” \f*
From the cry for help of Heshbon, up to Elealeh,
up to Jahaz, they give their voice,
from Zoar up to Horonaim, \add up to\add* Eglath-shelishiyah,
for even the waters of Nimrim have become as a desolation.
And I will cause to disappear for Moab,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:35 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“\add the\add* one who presents a sacrifice \add at\add* a high place,
and \add the one who\add* burns a smoke offering to his gods.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 48:36 \ft Literally “Unto thus” \f* my heart moans for Moab like the flute.\f + \fr 48:36 \ft Hebrew “flutes” \f*
It moans for the people\f + \fr 48:36 \ft Or “men” \f* of Kir-heres like the flute.\f + \fr 48:36 \ft Hebrew “flutes” \f*
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 48:36 \ft Literally “Unto thus” \f* \add the\add* wealth they gained has perished.
For \add on\add* every head \add is\add* baldness,
and every beard is trimmed.
On all \add the\add* hands, slashes,
and on \add the\add* loins, sackcloth.
On all the roofs of Moab, and in its public squares,
\add there is\add* wailing everywhere.
For I have broken Moab like a vessel,
there is no delight in it,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:38 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“How it is filled with terror! \add How\add* they wail!
How Moab has turned \add his\add* back! He is disgraced!
So Moab has become as a derision,
and as a terror for all his surrounding \add peoples\add*.”
For thus says Yahweh,
“Look, like an eagle he will swoop down,
and he will spread out his wings against Moab.
Kerioth will be taken,
and the strongholds will be conquered,
and the hearts\f + \fr 48:41 \ft Hebrew “heart” \f* of the warriors of Moab will be on that day
like \add the\add* heart of a woman \add who\add* is in labor.
And Moab will be destroyed from \add being\add* a people,
because against Yahweh he magnified himself.
Dread, and pit, and a trapping net \add are\add* against you,
O inhabitant of Moab,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:43 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“He \add who\add* flees ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 48:44 \ft Literally “from the face of” \f* the dread
will fall into the pit,
and the \add one who\add* climbs up from the pit
will be caught in the trapping net,
for I will bring on Moab
the year of their punishment,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:44 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“In the shadow of Heshbon
fugitives stand without strength,
for a fire has gone out from Heshbon,
and a flame from Sihon.
And it has eaten the forehead of Moab,
and the skulls\f + \fr 48:45 \ft Hebrew “skull” \f* of the people\f + \fr 48:45 \ft Or “sons” \f* of tumult.
Woe to you, Moab!
The people of Chemosh have perished.
For your sons have been taken into captivity,
and your daughters into captivity.
Yet I will restore the fortunes\f + \fr 48:47 \ft Hebrew “fortune” \f* of Moab
in the last of the days,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 48:47 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
⸤Thus far⸥\f + \fr 48:47 \ft Literally “Up to here” \f* \add is\add* the judgment of Moab.
